meanings.definition: To make something appear old-fashioned or outdated.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys archaising her photographs to give them a vintage look.
meanings.sent2: The artist was archaising the furniture to match the historical theme of the room.
meanings.sent3: The students had a fun time archaising their school project to look like it was from a different era.
meanings.sent4: The movie director was archaising the set to transport the audience back in time.
meanings.sent5: By archaising the costume, she transformed into a character from the past.

meanings.sent2: The play was an archaising of a classic Shakespearean tragedy.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer's collection was an archaising of 1920s glamour.
